body.p: To his Excellency Gov Magoffin Gov of Ky.
Your Petitioner would humbly represent that he has been fined the sum of Fifty dollars at the present term of the Franklin Circuit Court for selling to ^a^ Minor spiritous Liquors --

Your petitiner would represent that he knew of no such law forbidding him to sell to Minors -- that he was duly licenced to sell Liquors -- that the Minor had been doing business for him self and that he had always regarded him as of Age -- also from his personal appearance any one would regard him as a full man in age as well as development --
Your Petitioner would further represent that he is a poor man with a large family of children and could not pay said fine without great sacrifices

Lewis.L. Sullivan
E L Nuttall
J. A. Crittenden D. Sheriff
P. U. Major C. A --
Sworn to in due form before the undersigned a Justice of the peace for Franklin County by Lewis L. Sullivan this 18th day of Feby 1862

Franklin Cir. Ct.
Respite 6 mo
B. M.
$50 } Liquor to a Minor
Remission Issd
L. L. Sullivan
Issd Feby 19. 1862
